New Records: Giancarlo Stanton hit a clutch home run in the eighth inning to power the Yankees to a 3-2 win over the Royals
Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton's home run was the decisive factor in the Yankees' victory
The Yankees' bullpen, including Kris Bubic and Luke Weaver, played a crucial role in securing the win
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees will turn to ace Gerrit Cole for the next game
Gerrit Cole's performance in Game 1 was a challenge, but he has a strong record this season
Post-Match Reflections: The game marked a historic occasion as it was the first postseason contest at Kauffman Stadium in over 3,000 days
Aaron Judge's offensive struggles continued, but the Yankees' patience at the plate and bullpen performance led to the victory
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals' defensive prowess was evident in early innings
The game was significant for both teams as they prepared for the next match in the series
Others: The Yankees' offensive efforts eventually paid off with Stanton's home run being the key factor
